alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 17 at 2:38PM PDT until March 22 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT ABOVE 5500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations late Saturday night through Sunday night of 4 to 15 inches possible. Total snow accumulations Monday morning through Wednesday morning of 6 to 24 inches above 3500 feet and 2 to 3 feet above 5000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph at times. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass and Highway 50 over Echo Summit. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels Saturday night and Sunday will be 5000-6000 feet falling to 3500 to 4500 feet Monday afternoon.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
